column1: Quitting smoking has a direct affect on your risk of cancer.
The sun's rays (UVA and UVB) damage skin cells.
It is unclear whether avoiding the sun or using sunscreen can prevent all skin cancers.

Being overweight (obese) puts you at higher risk for: - Breast cancer (after menopause) - Colon cancer - Endometrial cancer - Kidney cancer - Pancreatic cancer Your risk is higher if your body mass index (BMI) is high enough to be considered obese.

Drinking too much alcohol is linked to the following cancers: - Oral cancer - Esophageal cancer - Breast cancer - Colorectal cancer (in men) Limit your alcohol to 2 drinks per day for men and 1 drink per day for women or none at all.
The virus increases the risk for cancers of the cervix, penis, vagina, anus, and throat.
